title: How did Harry Potter celebrate Harry Potter's birthday? - Quora

response.answer_text: Before his first year at Hogwarts, he most likely wouldn’t have really celebrated it at all. The books state that the Dursleys never gave him presents, although most of the time they at least acknowledged the day as being his birthday. His eleventh birthday was celebrated by Hagrid bringing him a cake and telling him that he’s a wizard. This was his best birthday in his life thus far. His twelfth birthday was ignored by his aunt and uncle, but Dudley remembered, and mocked him for not having gotten any cards from his friends. Dobby also showed up and warned Harry not to go back to Hogwarts. We all know how that ended. His thirteenth birthday was fairly normal. He was sent presents by Hermione and Ron, and a letter from McGonagall about permission to go to Hogsmeade. On his fourteenth birthday, he received a birthday cake each from Sirius, Ron, Hermione, and Hagrid. His fifteenth birthday only granted him cards and chocolates from Ron and Hermione. However, he was mad at their lack of communication and secrecy regarding the Order, so he threw them out. His sixteenth birthday was celebrated at The Burrow, the only one thus far to be celebrated anywhere other than Privet Drive. The moods of the party changes for the worse once the death of Karkaroff, the kidnapping of Florean Fortescue and the disappearance of Olivander are brought up. His seventeenth birthday is the day before Bill and Fleur’s wedding, and so a small party is held at the Burrow. He got lots of presents from people including Ron, Hermione, Mr. Weasley, Bill, Fleur, Fred and George. Ginny kissed Harry because she ‘didn’t know what to get him’, even though they were broken up. Rufus Scrimegeour, minister of magic, interrupted the party to dole out items of Dumbledore’s will to Ron, Hermione, and Harry. Onwards from this, we’re unsure how Harry celebrated him birthdays, however I’d wager that they were in relative calm, surrounded by friends and family.
